channel.title: Who likes overclocking?
channel.description:
I do I do
Post your OC [img]http://i.imgur.com/JMhT9.png[/img]
Specs: CPU: i5 2500k overclocked @ 4.5GHz - Max Voltage 1.28 MOBO: ASRock Z77 Extreme 4 RAM: 4GB 1333MHz G Skill Ripjaws COOLER: Coolermaster hyper 212 evo PSU: OCZ ModXstream pro 600W CASE: Coolermaster 430 elite GFX CARD: None SCREEN: Crap 17" philips(temp)

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

[quote=“nacional, post:43, topic:449109”]alright I’m still too lazy to get into my comp and clean it, but on other news?

how much has been spent on steam sales?

50 here… so far.[/quote]
I didn’t buy shit due to not having a gfx card atm ect.

I had a steam account with mw2/Left 4 dead 2 and a few more which are decent playable games without a gfx card.

I’ve also still not touched mine, I added an extra cpu fan to my cooler and also too lazy to start better cable management and ect.

Read full topic

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:31, topic:449109”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=552005.msg4045714#msg4045714 date=1342090628]
yeah the cnps10x performa is/was the best performance air cooler under like $50, theres only a couple better which are huge noctua ones.
[/quote]
On my gaming PC I use crosshair IV Formula as motherboard, AMD FX 8-Core Processor Black Edition, and using 7 fans 4 of them are Noctua fans. (processor) - , working so good and they are soo quiet, I really like, and they’re not to expensive either.[/quote]
Didn’t your mom sell your gaming PC? At least that’s what you told be when we ran RSCFusion.

Read full topic

On my gaming PC I use crosshair IV Formula as motherboard, AMD FX 8-Core Processor Black Edition, and using 7 fans 4 of them are Noctua fans. (processor) - , working so good and they are soo quiet, I really like, and they’re not to expensive either.

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

@xEnt wtf that case is nice but for the price…

@Felipe We have the same case, I’d be interested to see your cable management as I’ve only done maybe 40% of it atm.

I’m looking for some quiet fans what push out a lot of CFM, my coolermaster sickleflows are great for the air flow there just not quiet as stated. 19dba on the case and its over 24dba when been like a metre away from the pc.

Read full topic

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:
@NoLives wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:22, topic:449109”][quote author=nacional link=topic=552005.msg4044931#msg4044931 date=1342024285]

I have the same processor also, I have it overclocked to 4.2 only though. Then again I don’t really care
for overclocking and all that, wha aftermarket cooler are you guys using?

Why type of cooling do you use?

inb4t4

air.

on my 2500k im at 5.1ghz prime95 24h stable, 1.47v it idles at 45c loads 65. thats on air

theres nothing better than a 5ghz cpu with a sandforce ssd.

what’s your aftermarket?
I can’t wait to buy my ssd, they are dropping in price so I’m waiting for the right moment.

looks like k09 beats us on most expensive cpu.

What about ocing video cards? I got the Asus 1gb 6950, I don’t really overclock it since it
gets unstable :s
[/quote]

running a zalman cnps10x performa with IC diamond 7 thermal compound.

as for video cards, i have 2x 6950s that are flashed and overclocked to 6970s, you should do the same.

whilst we are on it, how about monitors? my 27" yamakasi catleap is oc’d from 60 to 94hz refresh rate.[/quote]
Pretty casual

Read full topic

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

KO9:

Notice the multiplier is being lowered. This is because it’s using speedstep to conserve power. You can disable it in the BIOS but there’s no need really as it will jump up to a relevant multiplier if the CPU requires it.

Oh! Thank you for the information

Read full topic

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @nacional nacional
item.description:
@nacional wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:22, topic:449109”][quote author=nacional link=topic=552005.msg4044931#msg4044931 date=1342024285]

I have the same processor also, I have it overclocked to 4.2 only though. Then again I don’t really care
for overclocking and all that, wha aftermarket cooler are you guys using?

[/quote]

running a zalman cnps10x performa with IC diamond 7 thermal compound.

as for video cards, i have 2x 6950s that are flashed and overclocked to 6970s, you should do the same.

whilst we are on it, how about monitors? my 27" yamakasi catleap is oc’d from 60 to 94hz refresh rate.[/quote]

I can’t remember the name of the switch needed on a video card to do a safe flash, but anyways I don’t
have that so I haven’t really bother with. I might one day when games actually ask for it but I doubt
it since games are straight ports.
I have two monitors, one acer one gateway. Both 23.3 inches. Also I’m not sure if you are being serious
about ocing a monitor lol, never heard of that.

[quote=“waj, post:23, topic:449109”]@nacional

What SSD are you looking at? any size in mind?

Are you looking to use it just for a boot drive ect and not storage?

@xEnt/nacional

You guys know of any quiet fans what push out a lot of CFM?

Oh and what about cases guys?

Edit: Updated first post with my specs.[/quote]

I’m going for something inbetween 100-200 gbs. I’ll def. boot from there, and I’ll
probably put some games on it since my 1tb drive is almost full and I’m too lazy
to clean it atm.

I bought this case

newegg.com

RC-431P-KWN2 5BAY MID TWR BLK - Newegg.com

Buy RC-431P-KWN2 5BAY MID TWR BLK with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!


It’s pretty inexpensive, since I was scrapping for money so I went cheap with my
case so I could get a 6950 instead of a 6870 I was going for originally. It doesn’t have
good cable management but it’s spacey. We should prob take pictures of our cable management
I think I’ll post that tomorrow.

As for Fans, I have some cheap master cooler 120 silent Fan. It only pushes 44.73CFM but it’s
very quiet to the point I can’t hear it which I prefer over some that I had that pushed 70CFM
but were annoying. You could prob get high CFM with low sound but you’ll be spending.
edit: I cropped my speccy img on the first page

Read full topic

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt

Are you looking to use it just for a boot drive ect and not storage?

@xEnt/nacional

You guys know of any quiet fans what push out a lot of CFM?

Oh and what about cases guys?

Edit: Updated first post with my specs.[/quote]

as for cases and airflow, anything over $120 is usually good.

my case: http://hothardware.com/articleimages/Item1722/small_level-10-gt.jpg

its expensive, and i only bought it for its looks.

Read full topic

item.title: Who likes overclocking?
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:18, topic:449109”]This is my laptop… strange cuz the core speed is peaking from 700-900 then to 2500-3900…
Real wierd.

[/quote]
Notice the multiplier is being lowered. This is because it’s using speedstep to conserve power. You can disable it in the BIOS but there’s no need really as it will jump up to a relevant multiplier if the CPU requires it.

Read full topic
